intro: Corydalis cusickii, commonly known as the Sierra larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky stream banks. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Corydalis cusickii is part of the family Fumariaceae and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance.
